Instance_UUID.description: The unique identifier for this object. (A UUID specified by RFC4122).

Documentation.default: Unique numeric channel identifier.
Used to provide channel specific information messages (for instance triggered out of CNC part program).
Feedrate actual value.
The name identifying individual G function name.
Path of active CNC main program.
File offset of active CNC main program file (corresponds to the number of line feeds).
Line number of active CNC main program (usually defined as N<Number>).
Name of active CNC main program.
Active M Function
Active zero offset function (usually G54, G55, G56 or G57; G53 repeals zero offsets).

Channel active mode of operation. Possible operation modes are: Manual_0 - Operation mode Manual, incremental axis movement triggered by user. MDA_1 - Operation mode MDA, manual data input and execution. Automatic_2 - Operation mode automatic, execute CNC part programs.
Axis override actual value.
Block of lines containing the previous, actual and subsequent lines of a CNC part program.
Path of active CNC part program file (main or subprogram).
File offset of active CNC part program file (main or subprogram).
Line number of active CNC part program (main or subprogram).
Name of active CNC part program (main or subprogram).

Active channel program status. Possible states of the CNC part program execution: Stopped_0 - Active CNC part program in channel stopped (regular stop of CNC part program execution). Running_1 - Active CNC part program in channel running (error-free execution of CNC part program). Waiting_2 - Active CNC part program in channel in waiting state(e.g. dwell time or waiting for event). Interrupted_3 - Active CNC part program in channel interrupted (e.g. due to M00 or M01 command programmed in CNC part program). Canceled_4 - Active CNC part program in channel canceled (irregular stop of CNC part program execution).
Runtime of selected NC program ( in seconds ).
Total number of workpieces machined in current run.

Active status of channel. Possible states of a CNC channel: Active_0 - Channel active (regular execution of CNC channel). Interrupted_1 - Channel interrupted (e.g. due to an error). Reset_2 - Channel resetting (activate initial state).
Block mode status (true in case of block mode is active, else false). With block mode active, individual program blocks are processed one by one. Each step has to be triggered by the operator.
Time from the beginning of the block in seconds.
Feedrate setpoint value.
Override setpoint value.
Test feedrate.
Feed status (true in case of feed hold active, else false).

Pos_TCP_BCS_A.$comment: Actual rotation about X of the tool center point in machine Cartesian base coordinate system. The tool center point is the reference point on a tool how it is considered by the CNC tool compensation function. If there is no tool present, the tool center point is the tool carrier zero point.

The tool center point is the reference point on a tool how it is considered by the CNC tool compensation function. If there is no tool present, the tool center point is the tool carrier zero point.

Pos_TCP_WCS_A.$comment: Actual rotation about X of the tool center point in machine Cartesian workpiece coordinate system. The tool center point is the reference point on a tool how it is considered by the CNC tool compensation function. If there is no tool present, the tool center point is the tool carrier zero point.
